articles.author: Maya Gebeily
articles.description: An Israeli airstrike flattened a building near one of the busiest traffic junctions in the Lebanese capital.
articles.title: Israel hits Beirut suburb after US delivers truce proposal

articles.author: Jarrett Renshaw, Trevor Hunnicutt
articles.description: U.S. President Joe Biden will meet with Japan and South Korea's leaders on Friday as they seek to preserve their diplomatic progress ahead of a new Trump administration that many fear could upend alliances worldwide.
articles.title: Biden to meet South Korea, Japan leaders for pre-Trump huddle on risk

articles.author: Gabriel Stargardter
articles.description: Allies of French far-right leader Marine Le Pen have accused the judiciary of a witch-hunt and undue meddling in democracy after prosecutors requested she face an obligatory five-year ban from public office if convicted of misusing European Union funds.
articles.title: Le Pen allies decry witch-hunt as prosecutors threaten her French presidential hopes

articles.author: Eduardo Baptista
articles.description: With Donald Trump's imminent return to the U.S. presidency looming over the Asia-Pacific Economic Cooperation (APEC) summit in Lima, Chinese President Xi Jinping said on Friday that unilateralism and protectionism needed to be rejected in favour of economic globalization.
articles.title: As Trump return looms, China's Xi at APEC criticises protectionism

articles.author: Tom Balmforth, Yuliia Dysa
articles.description: President Volodymyr Zelenskiy said the German chancellor's phone call with Russia's leader on Friday opened a "Pandora's box" that undermined efforts to isolate Vladimir Putin and end the war in Ukraine with a "fair peace".
articles.title: Ukraine's Zelenskiy says Scholz-Putin phone call opens 'Pandora's box'

articles.author: Joyce Lee
articles.description: South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol told Chinese President Xi Jinping that their two countries should cooperate for peace in the face of North Korea and Russia's military cooperation, Yoon's office said on Saturday.
articles.title: South Korea's Yoon tells China's Xi cooperation needed on Russia, North Korea

articles.author: Lucy Papachristou, Filipp Lebedev, Mark Trevelyan
articles.description: Protesters stormed the parliament of the Russian-backed breakaway Georgian region of Abkhazia on Friday and demanded the resignation of its leader over an unpopular investment agreement with Moscow.
articles.title: Protesters demand leader's ouster in Russian-backed breakaway region of Georgia

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russian air defence units intercepted a series of Ukrainian drones in several Russian regions, officials said, many of them in Kursk region, where Ukrainian troops launched a major incursion in August.
articles.title: Russian air defences down Ukrainian drones in different regions

articles.author: Catarina Demony
articles.description: Activists, artists and academics brought together by German cultural project Dekoloniale gathered in Berlin on Friday, 140 years after European leaders divided up the African continent between them, to discuss the legacy of colonialism and reflect on the Berlin Conference of 1884.
articles.title: German project reinvents 1884 Berlin Conference to mull legacy of colonialism

articles.author: Thomas Escritt, Andreas Rinke
articles.description: German Chancellor Olaf Scholz urged Russian President Vladimir Putin on Friday in their first phone call in nearly two years to pull his forces out of Ukraine and begin talks with Kyiv that would open the way for a "just and lasting peace".
articles.title: Germany's Scholz urges Putin in phone call to open talks with Ukraine
